TITLE: Executing Shell Commands with Zx in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: A sample Zx script demonstrating various capabilities including executing shell commands, capturing command output, using template literals for variable interpolation, running parallel processes, and handling spaces in filenames.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
#!/usr/bin/env zx

await $`cat package.json | grep name`

const branch = await $`git branch --show-current`
await $`dep deploy --branch=${branch}`

await Promise.all([
  $`sleep 1; echo 1`,
  $`sleep 2; echo 2`,
  $`sleep 3; echo 3`,
])

const name = 'foo bar'
await $`mkdir /tmp/${name}`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Shell Commands with ZX in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Basic example of a ZX script that demonstrates command execution, variable interpolation, parallel processing, and working with shell commands. The script shows how to execute shell commands and capture their output using the $ template literal syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/getting-started.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
#!/usr/bin/env zx

await $`cat package.json | grep name`

const branch = await $`git branch --show-current`
await $`dep deploy --branch=${branch}`

await Promise.all([
  $`sleep 1; echo 1`,
  $`sleep 2; echo 2`,
  $`sleep 3; echo 3`,
])

const name = 'foo bar'
await $`mkdir /tmp/${name}`
```

TITLE: Using Synchronous and Asynchronous Command Execution in Zx
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to run commands in both synchronous and asynchronous modes using the $ function. Async mode returns a ProcessPromise while sync mode returns a ProcessOutput.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const list = await $`ls -la`
const dir = $.sync`pwd`
```

TITLE: Passing Environment Variables in zx Scripts
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set and use environment variables within zx scripts. The environment variable 'FOO' is set to 'bar' and then accessed within a shell command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/faq.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
process.env.FOO = 'bar'
await $`echo $FOO`
```

TITLE: Finding Files with glob()
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the glob() function to find files matching specified patterns. This is a wrapper around the globby package and supports both async and sync operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const packages = await glob(['package.json', 'packages/*/package.json'])
const markdowns = glob.sync('*.md') // sync API shortcut
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Suppressing Command Errors with nothrow Option
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to suppress errors when executing commands by using the nothrow option. This returns a ProcessOutput with details about the error instead of throwing an exception.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const o1 = await $({nothrow: true})`exit 1`
o1.ok       // false
o1.exitCode // 1
o1.message  // exit code: 1 ...

const o2 = await $({nothrow: true, spawn() { throw new Error('BrokenSpawn') }})`echo foo`
o2.ok       // false
o2.exitCode // null
o2.message  // BrokenSpawn ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Temporary Files with tmpfile()
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create temporary files using the tmpfile() function. Supports creating empty files, files with content, and files with specific permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
f1 = tmpfile()         // /os/based/tmp/zx-1ra1iofojgg
f2 = tmpfile('f2.txt')  // /os/based/tmp/zx-1ra1iofojgg/foo.txt
f3 = tmpfile('f3.txt', 'string or buffer')
f4 = tmpfile('f4.sh', 'echo "foo"', 0o744) // executable
```

TITLE: Executing Commands and Obtaining ProcessOutput in zx (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to execute a command using zx and obtain a ProcessOutput object. The command is executed using the $ template literal, returning a ProcessPromise which can be awaited to get the ProcessOutput.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/process-output.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const p = $`command` // ProcessPromise
const o = await p     // ProcessOutput
```

TITLE: Error Handling with ProcessOutput in ZX
DESCRIPTION: Example of handling errors when a shell command fails by catching the ProcessOutput exception. This shows how to access the exit code and error output when a command fails.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/getting-started.md#2025-04-17_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
try {
  await $`exit 1`
} catch (p) {
  console.log(`Exit code: ${p.exitCode}`)
  console.log(`Error: ${p.stderr}`)
}
```

TITLE: Creating Custom Execution Presets with $({...})
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create custom presets for command execution by using $ as a factory function. This allows setting different options like environment variables and verbosity levels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const $$ = $({
  verbose: false,
  env: {NODE_ENV: 'production'},
})

const env = await $$`node -e 'console.log(process.env.NODE_ENV)'`
const pwd = $$.sync`pwd`
const hello = $({quiet: true})`echo "Hello!"`
```

TITLE: Basic ProcessPromise Usage in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates basic usage of ProcessPromise for command execution and awaiting results

const o = await p    // ProcessOutput

TITLE: Importing zx Functions into Node.js Scripts
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to explicitly import the '$' function from zx into a regular Node.js script. This allows using zx functionality without using zx as the script runner.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```

import {$} from 'zx'

```

TITLE: Changing Directory with cd()
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to change the current working directory using the cd() function. This affects the context for subsequent command executions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```

await $`pwd` // => /tmp

TITLE: Using Command Output as Input to Other Commands
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use the output of one command as input to another command in ZX. This demonstrates command composition and automatic handling of newlines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/getting-started.md#2025-04-17_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```

await $`echo Current date is ${date}.`
```

TITLE: Retrying Operations with retry()
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to retry operations using the retry() function. Supports specified number of attempts, delay between attempts, and exponential backoff.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const p = await retry(10, () => $`curl https://medv.io`)

// With a specified delay between attempts.
const p = await retry(20, '1s', () => $`curl https://medv.io`)

// With an exponential backoff.
const p = await retry(30, expBackoff(), () => $`curl https://medv.io`)
```

TITLE: Passing Input to Command Execution
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to provide standard input (stdin) to commands using the input option. Input can be provided as string, Buffer, Readable stream, or output from another command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const p1 = $({ input: 'foo' })`cat`
const p2 = $({ input: Readable.from('bar') })`cat`
const p3 = $({ input: Buffer.from('baz') })`cat`
const p4 = $({ input: p3 })`cat`
const p5 = $({ input: await p3 })`cat`
```

TITLE: Controlling Verbose and Quiet Modes in zx
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to control the output verbosity in zx scripts. It shows global and in-place methods for enabling verbose mode or suppressing command output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/faq.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Global debug mode on
$.verbose = true
await $`echo hello`

// Suppress the particular command
await $`echo fobar`.quiet()

// Suppress everything
$.quiet = true
await $`echo world`

// Turn on in-place debug
await $`echo foo`.verbose()
```

TITLE: Combining JavaScript and Bash in a Markdown Script for zx
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to structure a Markdown file that includes both JavaScript and Bash code blocks. It shows how to use zx to execute shell commands within JavaScript and provides a Bash example for comparison.

`ls` â€” is an unix command to get directory contents. Let's see how to use it in `zx`:

TITLE: Options Interface for Command Execution
DESCRIPTION: Defines the TypeScript interface for all available options when executing commands with Zx. These options control various aspects of the command execution environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface Options {
  cwd:            string
  ac:             AbortController
  signal:         AbortSignal
  input:          string | Buffer | Readable | ProcessOutput | ProcessPromise
  timeout:        Duration
  timeoutSignal:  NodeJS.Signals
  stdio:          StdioOptions
  verbose:        boolean
  sync:           boolean
  env:            NodeJS.ProcessEnv
  shell:          string | true
  nothrow:        boolean
  prefix:         string
  postfix:        string
  quote:          typeof quote
  quiet:          boolean
  detached:       boolean
  preferLocal:    boolean | string | string[]
  spawn:          typeof spawn
  spawnSync:      typeof spawnSync
  store:          TSpawnStore
  log:            typeof log
  kill:           typeof kill
  killSignal:     NodeJS.Signals
  halt:           boolean
}
```

TITLE: Default Configuration Settings in ZX
DESCRIPTION: Shows the complete default configuration object with all available options and their default values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/configuration.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
$.defaults = {
  cwd:            process.cwd(),
  env:            process.env,
  verbose:        false,
  quiet:          false,
  sync:           false,
  shell:          true,
  prefix:         'set -euo pipefail;',   // for bash
  postfix:        '; exit $LastExitCode', // for powershell
  nothrow:        false,
  stdio:          'pipe', // equivalent to ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe']
  detached:       false,
  preferLocal:    false,
  spawn:          childProcess.spawn,
  spawnSync:      childProcess.spawnSync,
  log:            $.log,
  killSignal:     'SIGTERM',
  timeoutSignal:  'SIGTERM'
}

TITLE: Creating Isolated Contexts with within()
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create isolated asynchronous contexts using the within() function. Changes to $ settings within the function do not affect the outer context.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/api.md#2025-04-17_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
await $`pwd` // => /home/path
$.foo = 'bar'

within(async () => {
  $.cwd = '/tmp'
  $.foo = 'baz'

  setTimeout(async () => {
    await $`pwd` // => /tmp
    $.foo // baz
  }, 1000)
})

await $`pwd` // => /home/path
$.foo // still 'bar'
```

TITLE: ProcessOutput Interface Definition in zx (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: Defines the ProcessOutput interface, which extends Error and includes properties and methods for accessing command execution results. It provides access to exit code, signal, stdout, stderr, and methods for parsing output in various formats.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/process-output.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface ProcessOutput extends Error {
  // Exit code of the process: 0 for success, non-zero for failure
  exitCode: number
  
  // Signal that caused the process to exit: SIGTERM, SIGKILL, etc.
  signal: NodeJS.Signals | null
  
  // Holds the stdout of the process
  stdout: string
  
  // Process errors are written to stderr
  stderr: string

  buffer(): Buffer

  json<T = any>(): T

  blob(type = 'text/plain'): Blob
  
  text(encoding: Encoding = 'utf8'): string

  // Output lines splitted by newline
  lines(): string[]
  
  // combined stdout and stderr
  toString(): string

  // Same as toString() but trimmed
  valueOf(): string
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Custom Logging in ZX
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement custom logging functionality with masking and output formatting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/google/zx/blob/main/docs/configuration.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import {LogEntry, log} from 'zx/core'

$.log = (entry: LogEntry) => {
  switch (entry.kind) {
    case 'cmd':
      // for example, apply custom data masker for cmd printing
      process.stderr.write(masker(entry.cmd))
      break
    default:
      log(entry)
  }
}
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
$.log.output = process.stdout
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
$.log.formatters = {
  cmd: (entry: LogEntry) => `CMD: ${entry.cmd}`,
  fetch: (entry: LogEntry) => `FETCH: ${entry.url}`
}
```
